source_sentence: 世尊復告大王：「汝當諦聽！
translation: The Bhagavān again addressed the great king, "You must listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，我為求無上正覺利益有情，乃有轉輪聖王名大喜見，七寶具足，獲四神通，於《長阿笈摩六十三品》中，已廣分別說。
translation: Once upon a time, when I sought to achieve unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for the benefit of sentient beings, there was a wheel-turning sage king named Great Pleasant View who was fully endowed with seven treasures and had acquired four supernormal powers, as explained in detail in the sixty-three chapters of the Nagarjuna.

source_sentence: 時喜見王倍樂正法，飯食供養五百獨覺，奉飲食已，人各別施上[疊*毛]一張，說伽他曰：「『已證廣大心，　　仁者莫放逸；　　施與持戒人，　　施必得增益。
translation: After serving food, each of them gave a [pile*hair] of food to the 500 pratyekbuddhas, and he said to them, "Don't be careless, you good man, because you've realized the vast mind; give to someone who observes the precepts, and your gift will surely be appreciated.

source_sentence: 此施人明達，　　信心得解脫；　　以證無罪心，　　當生得快樂。』」
translation: This donor will understand, and faith will lead to liberation; with this realization of a sinless mind, one will be born happy.'"

source_sentence: 爾時佛告大王：「勿作異念！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the king, "Don't think differently!

source_sentence: 爾時轉輪王有七寶具足、獲四神通，即我身是。
translation: At the time, the wheel-turning king had a full complement of seven treasures and had acquired the four supernormal powers, which are mine.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，作是捨施，雖不獲得無上正等正覺；為此因緣，積集善根，是故而今得成正覺。」
translation: Although I didn't attain unsurpassed correct awakening because I made this kind of almsgiving, I accumulated good roots for this reason, and now I've attained correct awakening."

source_sentence: 佛復告大王：「我為求無上正覺，作捨施功德，汝當諦聽！
translation: Again, the Buddha told the king, "I've made this merit of generosity in order to pursue unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, so listen closely!

source_sentence: 如往昔有一婆羅門名曰時至，是大豪姓，每行施法施諸婆羅門。
translation: "In the past, there was a brāhmaṇa named Rang, a great and powerful man who used to give alms to the brāhmaṇas whenever he practiced giving.

source_sentence: 用八十四萬大象，莊嚴金具，皆以清淨金幢覆蓋，金網垂下，悉以金莊。
translation: He used 840,000 large elephants adorned with gold implements, all covered with a pure gold banner, and a gold net hung down over them, and they were all adorned with gold.

source_sentence: 此象施與婆羅門等，於《毘羅摩經》中說，如《中阿笈摩經》。
translation: This offering of elephants to brāhmaṇas and so forth is described in the *Vīlāma Sūtra*, as it is in the *Middle Agamas*.

source_sentence: 作此功德，說伽他曰：「『施已願彼樂，　　我施住無畏；　　以施供世間，　　天及諸人等。
translation: After bestowing this merit, he said to the bhagavān, "May they be delighted by my gift, for I will abide in fearlessness and offer it to the world, gods, humans, and so forth.

source_sentence: 若求一切樂，　　捨施住無畏；　　能求當解脫，　　大富為人主。』」
translation: If I seek all happiness, I'll abandon charity and abide in fearlessness; I'll be liberated if I seek it, and I'll be the lord of men with great wealth.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「往時時至豪姓婆羅門，施八十四萬金莊嚴象者，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "That man who once visited a wealthy brāhmaṇa and gave 840,000 gold ornaments to an elephant was me.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，為捨施故，未即證無上正覺；猶彼因緣，有正信緣，是故而今功德圓滿，乃得無上正等正覺。
translation: At the time, I hadn't immediately realized unsurpassed perfect enlightenment because I gave alms; just like those causes and conditions, I had the conditions of correct faith, so now I've completed my merits and attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 復次大王，我為求無上正等正覺，能行捨施，作福利時。
translation: Furthermore, Great King, when I sought the unsurpassed correct awakening, I was able to practice almsgiving and work for its welfare.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Great King, listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，有轉輪王名曰吉勝，統領四洲，具足七寶，有三神通，為無子息。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a wheel-turning king named Jisheng who ruled the four continents, possessed seven treasures, and had three supernormal powers, but he was childless.

source_sentence: 因求子故，思念作千方便。
translation: Because he was seeking a son, he thought about creating a thousand skillful means.

source_sentence: 時有一人來白王言：『有藥名為多子，宮人食者，當即有子。』
translation: Then, a man came to the king and said, 'There's a medicine called 'many children,' and if the palace staff eats it, they'll have children.'

source_sentence: 彼王聞有多子藥名，即求訪覓。
translation: When the king heard about the name of the medicine for prolific fertility, he sought it out.

source_sentence: 後時王得此藥，善細磨之，令入宮人飲已，便即妊娠。
translation: The king then obtained this medicine, finely ground it, and sent it to the palace for the people to drink, and they became pregnant.

source_sentence: 其王妃不知斯事，月滿生子，形貌端嚴，面如師子，有那羅延神力。
translation: The king's wife, who didn't know this, gave birth to a son with a dignified appearance, a face like a lion, and the spiritual powers of Nārāyaṇa.

source_sentence: 集諸眷屬，作生日會，為立名字，號曰茅草。
translation: She gathered her retinue together for a birthday celebration and gave her a name, calling it thatch.

source_sentence: 是時王子面前，自然而有妙螺及輪。
translation: A wonderful conch and wheel then naturally appear in front of the prince.

source_sentence: 王子若吹擊此螺，外軍聞者，皆悉退走；或有聞者，耳即便聾。
translation: If the prince blows on this conch, outside troops who hear it will retreat, and those who hear it will become deaf.

source_sentence: 若聞轉輪聲者，人皆走藏、或投屋穴。
translation: If anyone hears the sound of the wheel turning, they all run and hide, or they might throw themselves into a cave.

source_sentence: 降得外境，諸王伏已，來見父王，白言：『大王！
translation: After subduing the foreign forces, the kings subdued them and came to see their father, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 所有外境諸王，我皆降已。』
translation: I've subjugated all the kings of foreign lands.'

source_sentence: 父王聞已，甚大歡喜，即於比國為太子娶妃。
translation: When his father heard about this, he was overjoyed and took a wife for the prince in Bhīvatī.

source_sentence: 占星卜吉，集諸眷屬，為成婚禮。
translation: He divined the stars and fortune, gathered his retinue, and performed the marriage ceremony.

source_sentence: 彼之王女，見其太子形貌可畏，怕懼却走。
translation: When the king's daughter saw the prince's form and appearance, she was frightened and withdrew.

source_sentence: 是時太子即手持螺并輪及刀，隨後尋趁，在路乃見王家所有象馬，被師子食。
translation: The prince then took a conch, a wheel, and a sword in his hand and looked for her. On the road, he saw the elephants and horses belonging to the king's family being eaten by the lion.

source_sentence: 時守象馬人等，俱來告太子曰：『今象馬等被師子食噉，願見救之。
translation: The elephant and horse guards then all came to the prince and said, 'Now that the elephants and horses are being eaten and devoured by the lion, we'd like to see them saved.

source_sentence: 我等自有私象馬等，六分之中與太子一分。』
translation: We have our own private elephants and horses, and we'll give the prince one of the six parts.'

source_sentence: 于時太子即吹螺發聲，所有師子虎狼皆悉迸走。
translation: The prince then blew on a conch and made a noise, and all the lions, tigers, and wolves rushed away.

source_sentence: 是時太子告諸人曰：『我所合得六分之一者，留待我迴。』
translation: The prince then told the others, 'I'll take the sixth part that I've combined and leave it for my return.'

source_sentence: 告已，趁彼王女，其太子親眷將其兵士隨後復趁，太子告言：『却迴。
translation: After he told them, he took advantage of the king's daughter, and when his retinue took advantage of her, the crown prince told them, 'Turn back!'

source_sentence: 若決欲去，領取兵眾，往彼妃家。』
translation: If you're determined to leave, take the soldiers and go to his wife's house.'

source_sentence: 太子告曰：『我今獨去，不用兵眾。』
translation: The prince told them, 'Now, I'm going alone, and I won't use the troops.'

source_sentence: 說已兵迴，太子獨進。
translation: After he said that the troops had turned back, the prince went on alone.

source_sentence: 後時到彼妃國，妃父見已，告太子言：『將此女去。』
translation: When he arrived at his wife's country, her father saw him and told the prince, 'Take this woman away.'

source_sentence: 得女即迴，至彼調象所，報調象人曰：『與我六分之一。』
translation: He then returned, went to the elephant-master, and reported to the elephant-master, saying, 'Give me one-sixth of it.'

source_sentence: 其調象人答曰：『象被風吹將去。』
translation: The elephant tamer replied, 'The elephant will be blown away by the wind.'

source_sentence: 時太子說伽他曰：「『盛少狂醉象，　　其象被風將；　　況復牛羊等，　　心思須自知。』
translation: The prince then said to the elephant adjuster, 'A young, wild, and drunk elephant in his prime would be overcome by the wind; how much more so would a cow or sheep know what to think?'

source_sentence: 「爾時太子于時洗浴，身塗香藥取鏡自照，觀面乃見顏貌可畏，乃作是念：『我面如此，諸人見我。
translation: "The prince then washed himself, rubbed some medicine on his body, and looked at himself in a mirror. When he looked at his face, he saw that it was fearsome, and he thought, 'My face is like this, and people see me.

source_sentence: 我今何用此身？
translation: What am I doing with this body?'

source_sentence: 當須自害。』
translation: You must harm yourself.'

source_sentence: 即入叢林欲自害身。
translation: He then went into the forest and wanted to harm himself.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋觀見太子是賢劫中菩薩，若自害之必受大苦。
translation: Then the god Indra observed that the prince was a bodhisattva among the good eons, and if he harmed himself, he would surely suffer greatly.

source_sentence: 『我若變令端政，即不自死。』
translation: 'If I transform and make him properly govern, then he won't die by himself.'

source_sentence: 于時天帝與太子螺髻中寶珠，戴已，太子如天，形貌端嚴，獲具七寶。
translation: The emperor then gave the prince a precious pearl in a conch-tuft. After wearing it, the prince was like a god, with a dignified appearance and endowed with seven treasures.

source_sentence: 後時父亡，太子紹位，領四天下如法住持，七寶具足，有大威力轉輪聖王。
translation: When his father died, the crown prince assumed the throne, led the four worlds to abide in accord with the Dharma, was supplied with the seven treasures, and had the great authority of a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 六十萬城皆立義堂，俗依法祭祠，專修布施，經於多年。
translation: Six hundred thousand cities each erected a hall of merit, where the common people worshipped according to the Dharma and dedicated themselves to generosity for many years.

source_sentence: 經多百千歲，施一切婆羅門已，而說伽他曰：「『若多有受用，　　諸天及以人；　　發意不能施，　　多財而不捨。
translation: After many hundreds of thousands of years of giving to all the brāhmaṇas, he said, "Suppose there were many things to enjoy, which gods and humans find impossible to give with their minds, and they had lots of money but didn't abandon it.

source_sentence: 迷人慳執住，　　佛生須急施；　　持杖非是勇，　　能施心為猛。』」
translation: Attracted by stinginess and clinging to parsimony, a buddha is born to give hastily; holding a staff is not courageous, but giving is fierce at heart.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我於爾時，名茅草轉輪王，置六十萬義堂，行祭施法，廣修功德。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "At the time, I was known as the wheel-turning thatch king who built 600,000 purpose-built halls, performed ritual offerings, and cultivated virtue.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 莫作異見，彼是我身。
translation: Don't get the different view that this is my body.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，名茅草轉輪王。
translation: At that point, he'll be called the thatch wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 如是六十萬城，悉皆依俗造祭祠堂，施於一切，遍修福業。」
translation: Thus, 600,000 cities will build sacrificial shrines according to the customs, giving to all of them and cultivating good deeds."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我為捨施緣分，乃成無上正等正覺。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "It's for the condition of generosity that I've become the unsurpassed correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 莫作異念，我修此福，當證無上正覺，為因緣故、為信根故，積集善根。
translation: Don't think otherwise; I'll cultivate this merit and realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, accumulating good roots for the sake of causes and conditions and for the root of faith.

source_sentence: 復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我復為求無上正覺故，行施修福。
translation: "Again, I practice generosity and cultivate virtue in order to pursue unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，有王名曰三螺摩騰迦，有諸眷屬百千圍遶。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a king named Samloo Mātaṅga who was surrounded by a hundred thousand retinues.

source_sentence: 其王心行慈悲，利樂有情。
translation: The king's mind was compassionate and beneficial to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 其國飢儉，王發實語誓願，天即降雨，是以其國，常當豐熟。
translation: When his country was starving, the king made a vow of truthful speech, and the gods sent rain, so his country would always be prosperous.

source_sentence: 其王於後捨位出家，隨逐仙人，獲五神通。
translation: The king then renounced his position, left home, followed the sages, and attained the five supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 於此時中，波羅痆斯有王名為梵德，正住其位，人民熾盛，豐樂安穩。
translation: At the time, there was a king of the Polos named Brahmadatta who was correctly abiding on his throne, and his people were flourishing and enjoying prosperity and stability.

source_sentence: 相師占之，於後十二年中天不降雨。
translation: A fortune teller divined that in the following twelve years the gods would not send rain.

source_sentence: 其王擊鼓宣令，告諸人民：『若能辦得十二年糧者，可住此國；若無能者，任向諸處。』
translation: The king beat his drum and announced the order, telling the people, 'If you can get twelve years' worth of provisions, you may stay in this country; if you can't, you may go somewhere else.'

source_sentence: 國內諸人共相議論：『今既飢儉，可作何計？
translation: The people of the kingdom all discussed with each other, 'Now that we're starving, what can we do?'

source_sentence: 欲向何處？』
translation: Where do you want to go?'

source_sentence: 其中有人言：『我聞摩騰迦國境有仙人，說實言誓，天即降雨，每常豐熟，糧食充足。』
translation: One of them said, 'I've heard that there's an immortal in the land of Mātaṅga who says a true vow, and the gods send rain that always produces plenty of food.'

source_sentence: 時諸人等，為少食故，皆悉投於摩騰迦國。
translation: All of those people then, because they had so little to eat, threw themselves into the land of Mātaṅga.

source_sentence: 為父王出家，太子住位。
translation: They left home for their father the king and took up residence as crown prince.

source_sentence: 所有人民投國來者，十二年中，資給食糧悉皆充足。
translation: All the people who defected to that country were supplied with food and provisions for twelve years.

source_sentence: 梵德王問群臣曰：『我國內人，今何所在？』
translation: King Brahmā asked the ministers, 'Where are the people of our country now?'

source_sentence: 大臣答曰：『如上廣說，在摩騰迦仙人國中。』
translation: The ministers answered, 'As was explained in detail above, it's in the land of the sages Mātaṅga.'

source_sentence: 其王復告諸臣：『今時飢儉，如末劫年。
translation: The king then addressed his ministers, 'Now we're starving, like in the last eon.

source_sentence: 我等作何方計，得免斯苦？』
translation: What can we do to avoid this suffering?'

source_sentence: 諸臣答曰：『摩騰迦天，今以出家，證其仙道，宜可迎請。』
translation: The ministers replied, 'Now that Mātaṅga has left home and realized his immortal path, it would be appropriate to invite him.'

source_sentence: 其梵德王即詣摩騰迦仙人所，啟請白言：『我之國內，極大飢儉，猶如末劫。
translation: King Brahmadeva then went to the sage Mātaṅga and asked him, 'In my country, there's great hunger and poverty, and it's like the last eon.

source_sentence: 唯願大仙降至我國，發實言誓。』
translation: Please let the great sage come down to our country and make a true vow.'

source_sentence: 時仙受請，即往梵德王國，發實言曰：「『我生在於旃陀羅，　　亦無惡心損害意；　　三螺所說普應知，　　諸天及人皆悉見。
translation: When the sage accepted the invitation, he went to the kingdom of Brahmā and spoke truly, saying, 'I was born here in Cāṇḍāla, and I have no bad intentions or harmful thoughts; what the three conchs say should be generally known, and gods and humans alike should see it.'

source_sentence: 如是我今真實語，　　熏修慈心已久行；　　普為法界諸眾生，　　願龍降雨濟飢人。
translation: Thus, I've spoken truly now, cultivating a compassionate mind that's been practiced for a long time; for all sentient beings in the Dharma realm, may dragons send rain to help the hungry.

source_sentence: 從生已來所修善，　　久習慈心憐愍故；　　以此無量真實語，　　龍當降雨救眾生。』
translation: Because of the goodness I've cultivated since birth and the compassion I've cultivated over time, the dragon will rain down rain to save sentient beings because of these measureless, true words.'

source_sentence: 「爾時仙人發此願已，應時婆羅痆斯天降大雨，飢儉既息，變成豐稔。
translation: "After the sage made this vow, the gods of Vārāṇasī then sent down a great rain, which stopped the famine and turned it into a bountiful harvest.

source_sentence: 城中諸人，先在摩騰迦國者，皆悉歸還，並存舊業。」
translation: All the people in the city who were previously in the country of Matsaka returned and retained their old karma."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「往時三螺摩騰迦王者，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "The king of Mātaṅga who used to be the three conchs is me.

source_sentence: 我於往昔，心行慈愍，利益有情。
translation: In the past, I acted with kindness and compassion in my heart to benefit sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若發實語，天即降雨，能除飢儉，常得豐熟。
translation: If I spoke truly, the gods would send rain, which would remove hunger and poverty and always produce plenty.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 我昔非唯以捨施故證無上菩提，而更修無量福德因緣故，積集善根，起正信故，得證無上正等菩提。」
translation: It wasn't just through generosity that I realized unsurpassed enlightenment in the past, but also by cultivating measureless causes and conditions of merit, accumulating good roots, and generating correct faith that I realized unsurpassed perfect enlightenment."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我為求無上菩提故，修行布施、作諸福業。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "I cultivated generosity and created meritorious activities in order to pursue unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，彌地羅國有轉輪王名為大天。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a wheel-turning king in the country of Midīra named Mahādeva.

source_sentence: 我於《中阿笈摩》已廣說訖。
translation: I've explained it in detail in the Middle Length Āgama.

source_sentence: 其王自見己身有大受用，作諸祭祠之法，而說伽他曰：「『若心求大富，　　天上及人間；　　隨力應行施，　　為畏貧窮故。
translation: Seeing for himself that he had great rewards, the king created various rituals for his ancestors and taught the kārttika, saying, 'If you seek great riches in your mind, you'll find them up in heaven or among humans; you should give as much as you can because you fear poverty.

source_sentence: 施者人所奉，　　後必受天供；　　人非人歸依，　　如雨能成實。』」
translation: Those who give are worshipped by people, and later they'll be offered offerings from heaven; humans and non-humans take refuge in them, just like rain that makes things real.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「勿作異念！
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Don't think differently!

source_sentence: 彼時大天轉輪王者，決向善道，常修梵行，八萬四千生中常得轉輪王位。
translation: That great celestial wheel-turning king was determined to pursue a good path, always cultivated the religious practice, and always attained the position of wheel-turning king in 84,000 lifetimes.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 莫作異念，爾時轉輪王者，即我身是。
translation: Don't think otherwise, for at that point, the wheel-turning king is me.

source_sentence: 復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 我豈唯以此施證無上覺？
translation: Is this the only way I can realize unsurpassed enlightenment?

source_sentence: 而更修無量福業因緣，積集善根故、起正信故，得證無上正等正覺。」
translation: They then cultivated measureless causes and conditions of meritorious activity, which accumulated good roots and gave rise to correct faith, and they realized unsurpassed correct enlightenment."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我昔為求無上菩提故，修行布施、作諸福業。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "In the past, I cultivated generosity and created meritorious actions in order to pursue unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於彌地羅城有轉輪王名泥彌多，我亦先於《阿笈摩經》中廣說。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a wheel-turning king named Nirmāṇarati in the city of Midīra, which I also explained in detail in the Āgama-sūtra.

source_sentence: 其王自見己身有大受用，作俗間祭祀之法，布施一切，而說頌曰：「『若見作善法，　　隨他還作善；　　懈怠不作者，　　是卑下丈夫。』
translation: Seeing that he had great rewards for himself, the king performed secular rituals and gave alms to all living beings, saying, 'If you see something good being done, follow others to do it again; if you're lazy and don't do it, you're a lowly man.'

source_sentence: 「爾時帝釋天主告泥彌多王曰：『汝可來至我宮，受我五欲天樂，歡娛遊戲，隨意受樂。』
translation: "It was then that the lord Indra addressed King Nirmāṇarati, 'Come to my palace and accept my five heavenly pleasures, rejoice and play, and enjoy them as you like.'

source_sentence: 時王即以伽他答曰：「『如借他器物，　　依限終須送；　　天樂亦如是，　　猶如暫借物。
translation: The king then replied with a reply, 'It's like borrowing a container from another and depending on its limit, you must eventually give it away; so are the pleasures of the gods, which are like borrowing something for a while.

source_sentence: 我歸彌地羅，　　多造諸福業；　　當來彼宮內，　　承福生天上。』
translation: I've returned to Midera, created many meritorious deeds, and will come to that palace to accept the fortune of birth in the heavens.'

source_sentence: 「爾時彌地羅歸本城已，修行布施、作諸福業，而說頌曰：「『善仁讚行施，　　隨時而行捨；　　剎利梵薜舍，　　旃茶戍達陀。
translation: "After he returned to his home city, Nandika cultivated generosity and created meritorious works, and he spoke a verse, saying, 'Good people praise the practice of generosity and the practice of charity at appropriate times; Bṛhatphala Vaiśālī and Cāṇḍāśodhar.

source_sentence: 飢儉時行捨，　　行者令充足；　　當離惡趣中，　　必得生天上。
translation: Doing charity when you're hungry and weary, the practitioner makes enough; he'll leave the bad destinies and surely be born up in heaven.

source_sentence: 智者知此德，　　施者能為捨；　　由施得解脫，　　富貴而生天。』」
translation: A wise person knows this virtue, and a donor can bestow it; because of generosity, they'll be liberated, and wealthy and powerful will be born in the heavens.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「勿作異念！
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Don't think differently!

source_sentence: 往時泥彌轉輪王往三十三天，帝釋請分座而坐，受五欲樂，猶於彌地羅城門所置祭堂，依法祭祀，行施修諸福業者，即我身是。」
translation: When the Nimi wheel-turning king went to the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, Tīrṣa invited him to share a seat and sit down to experience the five desires and pleasures just as he had placed an altar at the entrance of the city of Midīra, offering sacrifices in accordance with the law and performing acts of giving and cultivating merits, which is me."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「非唯緣此行施福業而證正覺。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "It's not just because of this practice of meritorious acts of generosity that I've realized right awakening.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 勿作異見，而因行施故、起正信故、積聚善根故，今得正覺。」
translation: Don't hold different views; it's because of your generosity, right faith, and the accumulation of good roots that you've now attained right awakening."

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 我為求無上菩提故，而行捨施、修諸福業。
translation: I practice generosity and cultivate meritorious actions in order to pursue unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 王今諦聽！
translation: Now, listen closely, Your Majesty!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，有王名曰阿難陀，王有五子，其最小子，號為鏡面。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a king named Ānanda who had five sons, the youngest of whom was named Mirror-Face.

source_sentence: 後時大王身染病患，醫人處方，用根莖葉枝果種種藥療，竟治不差，惟加困篤。
translation: Some time later, the king was stricken with a disease, and the doctors prescribed a variety of medicines made from roots, stems, leaves, branches, and fruits, but the treatment was not successful and he became increasingly distressed.

source_sentence: 臨命終時速喚群臣：『我今臨命，須立別王。』
translation: When he was about to die, he quickly summoned his ministers, 'Now that I'm about to die, I need to make a different king.'

source_sentence: 臣等問曰：『欲建立誰？』
translation: The ministers asked, 'Who do I want to establish?'

source_sentence: 告曰：『有福德者，有天分者，置寶鞋履；宮人受語者；見六藏者，見內藏、外藏、內外藏、樹間、山間、水間藏者，可建立為王。』
translation: He told them, 'Those of good fortune and natural ability who have treasured shoes and footwear, those who are spoken to by the palace staff, and those who see the six stores, which are the inner store, outer store, inner and outer store, store among trees, mountains, and water, may be established as kings.'

source_sentence: 說已命終。
translation: After he finished speaking, his life ended.

source_sentence: 諸臣試練，何子堪為？
translation: Which of the ministers will be qualified to train him?'

source_sentence: 唯有最小鏡面王子堪紹王位而有天分。
translation: Only the youngest, the mirror-faced prince, was worthy of the throne and had natural abilities.

source_sentence: 既登寶位，并與寶履，令入宮中。
translation: Once he had ascended to the throne, he was given a jeweled footstool and told to enter the palace.

source_sentence: 諸宮人見，皆悉恭敬，見六庫藏，如前所說。
translation: All the people in the palace looked at them with respect and saw the six treasuries as explained above.

source_sentence: 乃至樹間藏者，王住樹下，下有庫藏。
translation: "Even the storehouse among the trees" means the king lives under a tree, and there's a storehouse underneath it.

source_sentence: 若在山間，及王園苑，亦復如是。
translation: If he were to live on a mountain or in the king's garden, it would be likewise.

source_sentence: 水中藏者，王若遊戲地水之中，即時有藏。
translation: The treasury in the water: If the king plays in the water of the earth, there's immediately a treasury there.

source_sentence: 群臣既見鏡面王子有是果報，尊重貴勝，即立王位。
translation: When the ministers saw this reward for Prince Mirrorface, they respected him as noble and victorious, and he was installed on the throne.

source_sentence: 既紹位已，以法治國。
translation: After he was elevated to the throne, he ruled the country with law.

source_sentence: 國內飢儉，十二年中俗法祭祀，施一切人，所求皆與，知自快樂，而說頌曰：「『以法得財者，　　智人不積聚；　　施者名持戒，　　施與受施人。
translation: The king's people were starving, and for 12 years he made offerings according to secular customs, gave to all people who asked for it, and knew he was happy when he spoke a verse, saying, 'A man who obtains wealth by the Dharma is a wise man who doesn't accumulate it; a donor is called a man who observes the precepts and gives to those who receive it.'

source_sentence: 沙門婆羅門，　　貧乏令充足；　　捨此身已後，　　必得生天上。
translation: An ascetic or brāhmaṇa becomes poor and prosperous, and after renouncing this body, he'll surely be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 聰達如是解，　　正信解脫念；　　於施行勇猛，　　無悋常行施。』」
translation: They are wise enough to understand it this way, correctly believe in the mindfulness of liberation, and are courageous enough to perform it without stinginess and always give.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「勿作異念！
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Don't think differently!

source_sentence: 爾時王者，即我身是。
translation: "At the time, this was the king, which was me.

source_sentence: 我於爾時名鏡面王，十二年中，為飢儉故，普於一切有情而行惠施，所須受用，俗法祭祀皆悉能施，即我身是。
translation: At the time, I was called the mirror-faced king, and for 12 years, for reasons of hunger and thirst, I gave generosity to all sentient beings, accepting whatever was needed and offering sacrifices in common and in order, which is who I am.

source_sentence: 非但行施福業，證無上菩提。
translation: Not only did I perform the meritorious act of giving, but I realized unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 勿作此見，鏡面因行施故、起正信故、積聚善根故，今得菩提。
translation: Don't hold that view, for the mirror has now attained enlightenment because of generosity, right faith, and the accumulation of good roots.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我為求無上菩提故，而行布施、造作福業、發精進波羅蜜。
translation: I practice generosity, create meritorious actions, and give rise to the perfection of effort in order to pursue unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於般遮羅國有二王：一在北界、一在南界。
translation: Once upon a time, there were two kings of the country of Pañcāla: one in the northern sector and one in the southern sector.

source_sentence: 其北界王名曰財，城名龍閣，其王以法化世，人民熾盛，豐樂安穩，無諸詐偽賊盜疾疫，牛羊稻蔗在處充滿。
translation: The king of the northern sector was named Cai, and his city was called Nāgasena. That king taught the world by the Dharma, and his people prospered, were abundantly happy and stable, were free of fraud, thieves, pests, and epidemics, and were filled with cattle, sheep, and rice cane.

source_sentence: 其王以法治國，城側有一大池，烏鉢羅花等彌覆其上，復有種種眾鳥。
translation: The king rules his country, and on the side of the city there's a large pond covered with ocimum gratissimum flowers and other things, and there are also various birds.

source_sentence: 池中有一龍子，名曰妙生，時往興雲以降甘雨，令田豐熟，多足糧貯，皆行布施。
translation: In the pond is a dragon named Miaosheng, who sometimes goes out and generates clouds that send sweet rain, making the fields ripe and abundant with provisions, and they all give alms.

source_sentence: 其南界王，性行險惡兇麁，非法治國，常以枷禁打棒百姓。
translation: The king of the southern region is dangerous and fierce in nature, rules his country illegally, and often beats and rods the people with fetters.

source_sentence: 天不降雨，人並驚忙，捨投北界龍閣城中以求活命。
translation: When the gods didn't send rain, the people were frightened and threw themselves into the city of Dragaku in the northern sector to try to stay alive.

source_sentence: 其南界王因出城遊獵，乃見村舍空閑、神廟破壞，問群臣曰：『村中人物，今並何之？』
translation: When he went out hunting, the king of the southern sector saw the village houses empty and the temples destroyed, and he asked his ministers, 'What happened to the people in the village?'

source_sentence: 諸臣答曰：『比為飢儉，人皆飢急，投北界王。
translation: The ministers replied, 'It's like being hungry and destitute, and people are starving and throw themselves at the king of the northern sector.

source_sentence: 大王施我無畏，即具說因緣。』
translation: The king gave me fearlessness, and I'll explain the causes and conditions in detail.'

source_sentence: 王言：『恣汝無畏。』
translation: The king said, 'Grant me your fearlessness.'

source_sentence: 臣等答言：『北界有王名曰財，以法持國、以法化世，人民熾盛，安穩豐樂，無諸詐偽賊盜疾疫，牛羊稻蔗在處充滿，常好布施於諸沙門婆羅門，飲食資具受用豐足。
translation: The ministers answered, 'In the northern realm, there's a king named Wealthy, who maintains his country by the Dharma and transforms the world by the Dharma, whose people are prosperous, stable, and abundant, free of fraud, theft, and epidemics, whose cattle, sheep, rice, and cane are abundant everywhere, who always gives generously to ascetics and priests, and whose food and drink are provided and enjoyed in abundance.

source_sentence: 大王性行麁惡，枷禁打棒，百姓惶怖，走投北界龍閣城中。』
translation: The king's nature is so unwholesome that he shackles, binds, and beats the people, who are frightened and leave for the northern border city of Nāgasena.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『作何方計，令彼却來聚落居住？』
translation: The king asked, 'What plan did you use to make them come back to live in the village?'

source_sentence: 群臣答曰：『若大王如彼財王，行於慈愍、饒益眾生，不久諸人皆悉奔此城邑聚落。』
translation: The ministers answered, 'If the king were to act like that wealthy king and be compassionate and beneficial to sentient beings, it wouldn't be long before all of them would run away to this town or village.'

source_sentence: 臣復白王：『彼城更有好妙勝事，城側有池，池中蓮花彌覆其上，有好諸鳥，復有龍子名曰妙生，依時降雨，令得豐熟，為斯彼國人民快樂。』
translation: The ministers then said to the king, 'There's something even more beautiful and wonderful about that city, and there's a pond on its side that's covered with lotus flowers, has beautiful birds, and has a dragon named Myōson who sends rain at appropriate times to make things abundant and make the people of that country happy.'

source_sentence: 其王復告群臣曰：『作何方計，令彼龍子來此居止？』
translation: The king then addressed his ministers, 'What's the plan to get that dragon boy to come and stay here?'

source_sentence: 臣曰：『若有持呪之人，即可來至。』
translation: The ministers said, 'If there's someone who holds a spell, they can come.'

source_sentence: 時王即命群臣擊鼓宣令，若有能持明呪，令北界龍閣城中妙生龍子來於我處者，賞金一籠，復大供給。
translation: The king then ordered his ministers to beat the drum and declare that if anyone could hold a bright spell that would bring the dragon-child of Myōsō from the northern dragon tower city to my place, they would be rewarded with a cage of gold and a great offering.

source_sentence: 于時有一呪師名曰呪蛇，來詣臣所，白言：『若定與我此金籠者，我能呪喚妙生龍子來於此處。』
translation: Then a spellcaster named Dhāraṇī came to the ministers and said, 'If you definitely give me this gold cage, I can conjure up a wonderfully produced dragon child to come here.'

source_sentence: 時群臣等即與金籠，呪師曰：『待我呪龍至此，然後受之。』
translation: The ministers then gave the golden cage to the curse master, saying, 'Wait until I curse a dragon to come here, and then I'll accept it.'

source_sentence: 是時呪師即往龍閣城中，於池四面觀察池內，知龍住處，却來告諸臣曰：『我於第七日，龍子必來，汝等可作祭祀之法。』
translation: The curse master then went to the dragon tower and looked around the pond to see where the dragon was staying, but he came to the ministers and said, 'On the seventh day, the dragon will surely come, so you may perform the ritual.'

source_sentence: 是時龍子知彼呪蛇呪師來此，至第七日將詣彼國，『作何計免其離父母親里眷屬？
translation: The dragon then knew that the incantation for the snake was coming, and on the seventh day he would visit his country, 'What will he do to prevent him from leaving his parents, relatives, and retinue?'

source_sentence: 欲投何處，得免斯事？』
translation: Where do I want to go that I might be spared such a thing?'

source_sentence: 去池不遠，有二獵師居住：一名婆囉迦、二名頗囉迦，以求活計，池邊居止網捕水陸。
translation: Not far from the pond, there were two hunters living there: one was a brāhmaṇa, and the other was a brāhmaṇa who sought a living and lived near the pond, fishing for water and land with a stop net.

source_sentence: 其婆囉迦不久身死。
translation: That Brāhmaṇa soon dies.

source_sentence: 龍子作念：『頗囉迦獵師今見命存，我須投彼。』
translation: The dragon-child then thought, 'Now that the Bhāraka hunter has seen his life, I must throw myself in his lap.'

source_sentence: 「爾時龍子變為人形，詣獵師所，告曰：『汝知此城由誰而得如是人民熾盛，豐樂安穩，無諸詐偽盜賊疾疫，牛羊稻蔗在處充滿？』
translation: "It was then that the dragon son took on human form and went to the hunter's office and told him, 'Do you know who made this city so prosperous and comfortable for its people, so free of fraud, theft, disease, and pests, and so full of cattle, sheep, and rice cane?'

source_sentence: 獵師答曰：『我知此事，皆由大王心行慈愍，饒益一切，養活百姓。』
translation: The hunter answered, 'I know that this is all because the great king is kind-hearted and benevolent, and he feeds the people.'

source_sentence: 龍子告曰：『如汝所言，要然由王，更緣別事。』
translation: The dragon-child told him, 'As you say, it's certainly because of the king, but there's something else.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『更有，為此池中有一龍子，依時降雨。
translation: He replied, 'There's something else, because there's a dragon in this pond that rains down rain at the appropriate time.

source_sentence: 緣此人民熾盛，歡樂豐熟，多饒飲食。』
translation: It's because the people there are so prosperous and happy, and there's plenty to eat and drink.'

source_sentence: 龍子告曰：『若彼龍子被人將去，離父母眷屬。
translation: The dragon son told him, 'Suppose that dragon son is about to be departed and leaves his parents and retinue.

source_sentence: 汝見彼人，能作何事？』
translation: What would you do if you saw that person?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我能害之。』
translation: He answered, 'I can harm them.'

source_sentence: 龍子告曰：『汝識妙生龍子不？』
translation: The dragon told him, 'Do you know Miaosheng Nāgârjuna?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我比不識。』
translation: He answered, 'I don't know.'

source_sentence: 報言：『我是妙生龍子，今為南方般遮羅國師名曰呪蛇，欲來取我將去，今作祭祀結界之法。
translation: He replied, 'I'm Miaosheng Drau, son of a dragon who's now a teacher named Zhusheng Serpent in the southern country of Panchala who wants to come get me and take me away, so now I'm going to perform a ritual to form a boundary.

source_sentence: 却後七日來此之時，釘竭地羅木橛，種種色線繞池四邊，作法必將我去。
translation: When he comes here seven days from now, he'll pin a wooden stake of Kadira and thread of various colors around the four sides of the pond, creating a ritual that will surely lead me away.

source_sentence: 汝可且於一處藏隱，遙見作此攪水之時，即須射箭呪師要處，速來彼令攝呪，不然斫令頭落。
translation: You can hide in one place, but when you see this stirring up water from a distance, you must shoot an arrow at the curse master's head and quickly come to him to gather the spell, or else you'll chop off his head.

source_sentence: 必須先遣解呪，然後殺之。
translation: You must first send an antidote to the spell, and then kill him.

source_sentence: 不爾我常被呪縛，至死不脫。』
translation: If that's not the case, I'll always be bound by the spell, and I won't be freed until I die.'

source_sentence: 時獵師告龍子曰：『若獨令汝利益，猶故作之；況令王城人眾皆得利益，我何不作？
translation: The hunter then told the nāga, 'If it would benefit you alone, you might as well do it; why wouldn't I do it if it would benefit all the people of the king's city?'

source_sentence: 願無憂慮。』
translation: May there be no worries.'

source_sentence: 是時龍子即將獵師，視其藏隱僻處。
translation: The nāga then was about to hunt for a master and looked into his hidden place.

source_sentence: 獵師至第七日，彼彼藏處；其呪蛇師即來作壇，祭祀結界，一依呪印法，四面釘橛，種種色線繞之，即以箭射。
translation: When the hunter arrived on the seventh day, he went to his hiding place, where a snake charmer had built a stūpa, sacrificed to the sect, sealed it with a spell, pinned it on all sides, surrounded it with strings of various colors, and shot it with an arrow.

source_sentence: 速來前進攪池水，爾時獵師拔刀告曰：『我國之內妙生龍子，汝欲將去。
translation: He quickly went forward to stir up the water in the pond, and then the hunter drew his sword and told him, 'My country's interior is filled with wonderfully produced dragons, and you want to leave.

source_sentence: 若不速解呪法，刀斫汝頭，令墮於地。』
translation: If you don't quickly understand the spell, the sword will chop your head off and cause it to fall to the ground.'

source_sentence: 時呪蛇師於此苦痛，恐懼畏死，即解攝呪。
translation: The snake charmer then became frightened of this pain and fear of death, and he released the spell.

source_sentence: 解已，獵師斷彼命根，龍子得脫，出池抱彼獵師，白言：『仁者是我父母，為來相救，我今免離父母眷屬之苦。
translation: After he understood it, the hunter cut off his life force, and the dragon escaped, got out of the pond, embraced the hunter, and said, 'Sir, you're my father and mother, and you've come to save me from the pain of being separated from my parents and retinue.

source_sentence: 仁可相隨，向我宮中。』
translation: You may accompany him to my palace.'

source_sentence: 即共相逐入龍子宮，施設種種妙好飲食，與上寶珠。
translation: They then chased each other into the palace of the dragon, where they were fed a variety of wonderful foods and given the highest precious pearls.

source_sentence: 復告父母：『此是親支所投寄者，因此之人，今免愛別離苦。』
translation: They also told their parents, 'This is the person to whom my relatives have entrusted me, and this person will now be spared the pain of separation from their loved ones.'

translation: "It was then that the god Vaiśravaṇa, with his measureless retinue, passed by and was unable to move, and he was greatly perplexed, saying, 'I've traveled from place to place before, but I've never seen anything like this.'

translation: The god Vaiśravaṇa then commanded the fifth Yakṣa, 'Go quickly to the city of Kōanaka and subdue that enemy for the Boy of Good Fortune, so that he won't be harmed.'

translation: After the king commanded him, Yakṣa transformed into a four-strong army of soldiers, with men as tall as tārā trees, elephants as high as large mountains, and horses as large as elephants, created weapons and various forms, and blew a great drum to cause great fear.

translation: Showing great authority, they went to that enemy and thus demonstrated themselves.

source_sentence: 其城四面牆壁，被藥叉威力一時俱到，人民皆怪怕懼，問曰：『從何處來？』
translation: When the four walls of that city were overcome by the mighty power of Yakṣa, the people were struck by fear and asked, 'Where did this come from?'

translation: The celestial soldiers replied, 'Open your doors early, and the good fortune will be here soon, ready to be taken.

translation: The townspeople replied, 'We won't disobey the king, and we won't disobey the goodly treasures.'

translation: When he fell asleep, the king was terrified, and his hair stood on end. When he got up from sleep, he put his hand over his cheek and thought, 'I'm sure to be taken from the throne and will surely die.'

translation: After Joyful Mind heard this, she was greatly distressed and upset, so she went to her mother, wept, and told her the story as above.

translation: His mother said, 'Stay there for a short time, and I'll find out for myself whether it's true or not.'
